title: Eric Kent 2014 Kalen's Big Boy Blend Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: Brawny and vibrant in acidity, this well-made full-bodied wine is a study in softened tannin and texture, with an oomph of weight and breadth. Raspberry and black cherry shine alongside black pepper and cinnamon with a lasting tease of brick and leather.

title: Famille Quiot 2013 Les Combes d'Arnevel Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Pristine blackberry and raspberry are flecked with spice and earth in this plump yet freshly composed wine. A hint of rubber accentuates earthy, savory tones on the midpalate but these turn to prettier dried herb and lavender on the finish.

title: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée C  (Chiroubles)
description: This wine is rich and ripe with red fruits. Its structure and dry tannins suggest a wine that will age. Red berries, acidity and a dry core point to a well-structured wine to drink from mid-2018.

title: Foppiano 2014 Grant Station Carignane (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny, this is an inviting version of the variety, well-done by this historic producer. Baked plum is met by dusty, soft and rounded tannin structure, the oak supportive and happy in the background. The light spiciness adds a sense of richness. This is an ideal pizza wine.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de Roche Noire  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Firm and with a dry core, this wine has great concentration and rich tannins. Ripe fruit lies under this solid exterior, waiting to come through in the coming months. The wine will show great richness as it matures. Drink from 2019.

title: Geyser Peak 2014 Merlot (California)
description: Concentrated black cherry and black olive aromas have an earthy edge in this full-bodied wine, while the flavors are dry and potent black fruits with touches of dark chocolate. It's a well-structured wine that will improve through at least 2021.

title: Il Molino di Grace 2013 Il Margone Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Blue flower, baked plum and pipe tobacco aromas slowly take shape. The palate offers dried cherry, prune, star anise and crushed sage while firm acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins provide the austere backbone. Give this a few more years for the tannins to unwind. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Istine 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Balsamic aromas of camphor, eucalyptus and dried herb mingle with whiffs of blue flower and ripe plum. The taut, juicy palate delivers fleshy Marasca cherry, black raspberry and white pepper alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)
description: The vineyards on the steep hill leading down from the chapel of La Madone have given a structured wine. Weight and richness underly firm tannins. Concentrated and potentially full of fruit, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Keuka Spring 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Heady aromas of rose and jasmine meld with rich tangerine and red apple notes. Off-dry on the palate, melon and florals meet with plenty of acidic cut from grapefruit zest, leading to a candied lemon and ginger finish. Weight, power and balance make this an excellent offering from winemaker August Diemel.

title: Korbel NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)
description: Elegant and plush, this wine is both light and rich at the same time, as it combines a fine mousse of bubbles with good fruit and spice flavors and a creamy texture. Everything is well-blended and harmonious as well as concentrated enough to have a long and lightly ripe finish.

title: La Ferme du Mont 2013 Jugunda  (Gigondas)
description: Notes of forest floor, saddle and garrigue lend a rustic feel to this wine. Black-cherry and strawberry flavors are more muted than fresh, but nuanced and savory. It's moderately concentrated but lingers nicely, guided by a fringe of fine, upright tannins.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Van der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Rose garden and lavender aromas make for an inviting entry into this mountain-grown wine, as stiff, bristling acidity keeps it bright and lively in the glass. The texture is broadly soft and seductive, developing a silkiness on the finish.

title: Le Casque 2014 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Good fruit concentration and firm structure make a fine combination in this full-boded mouth-filling wine. It has a compelling dense chewy texture that supports lots of ripe black cherry and blackberry flavors with firm tannins.

title: Ledson 2013 Stagecoach Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A bold, bombastic, 100% varietal wine made from mountain fruit, this red was aged 30 months in all French oak, 52% of it new. It imparts burly notions of oak and tannin alongside graphite, cedar and sage highlights. Very ripe, it expands on the palate in blackberry and black pepper, never letting go of its power.

title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2013 Doña Bernarda Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Prickly, lightly herbal berry aromas are spicy, traditional and a touch rough. This is full in body but not overly packed with tannins. Flavors of herbal berry fruits and chocolate finish spicy, oaky and chocolaty, all of which are normal for a Colchagua red blend like this. Drink through 2023.

title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 LFE 900 Single Vineyard Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Ripe smooth aromas of lightly herbal black fruits are foresty and chocolaty. In the mouth, this Shiraz blend is fleshy but also tannic. Baked flavors of spiced black fruits spread out on a finish that's more bulky than it is finessed.

title: Maison Denuzière 2014 Aphrodite  (Condrieu)
description: Veins of waxy orange and lemon peels freshen this full-bodied but lively Viognier. Vanilla bean and tangerine flavors are rich and silky on the palate accented by fragrant swirls of honeysuckle. The finish is a tad warming but lingers pleasantly.

title: Maquis 2011 Lien Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Dark earthy rubbery aromas of spicy black fruits set up a saturated grabby palate with firm tannins. Spicy but ripe blackberry flavors finish with dark oaky flavors of coffee and toast. For a wine that's been in the bottle for over four years, this is in a comfortable state. Drink through 2020.

title: Marchesi Antinori 2015 Pèppoli  (Chianti Classico)
description: Heady aromas of ripe red berry, fragrant purple flower, truffle and dried aromatic herb take the lead. The smooth, savory palate doles out juicy wild cherry, black raspberry and baking spice. It's extremely enjoyable, with supple tannins.

title: Mazzei 2013 Ser Lapo Riserva Privata  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of exotic spice, pressed blue flower, menthol and an earthy whiff of forest floor slowly take shape. The tight, youthfully austere palate offers dried cherry, star anise, espresso and thyme while assertive, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide firm support. Best after 2020.

title: McCall 2010 Corchaug Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Spicy bramble berry aromas take on a slight brandied character, bathed in anise and savory dried meat tones. The plush, silken palate boasts some additional savory streaks, with shots of cranberry acidity keeping the weight in check. Soft tannins offer just enough support to carry this wine to the lingering rich, cherry finish.

title: Meerlust 2015 Pinot Noir (Stellenbosch)
description: There's an overt richness to this wine, with bold aromas and flavors of muddled berries and cherries that are hit by cocoa powder and Dr. Pepper. The medium-weight palate boasts a surprisingly firm and structured texture, with the lingering grip countering the ample ripe fruit. Drink now–2023.

title: Millbrook 2016 Proprietor's Special Reserve Dry Riesling (Hudson River Region)
description: Diffused aromas of citrus, sea spray and peach blossom envelop the nose, with apple peel, tart peach and jasmine marking the flavors. The medium-bodied palate is silken in feel, yet balanced by quinine acidity.

title: Neethlingshof 2015 The Owl Post Pinotage (Stellenbosch)
description: This wine starts off a bit tight and closed, dominated by cocoa nib and espresso bean notes that are coupled with char and earthy, rooty accents. The palate is similarly tightly wound, with black fruit flavors that are eager to harmonize with the overt oaky tones. It's all there, it just needs some time to align; drink 2020–2023.

title: Oro Bello 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Like a pear tart, this wine from a new small producer is full of baking spices, butter and fruit from the first whiff to the lingering, rich finish. While dry, it's full bodied, very lush and viscous in texture, and the yummy flavors are bold without going to extremes.

title: Patrick Tranchand 2016 Coeur de Gamay  (Saint-Amour)
description: This wine is called the heart of Gamay. The name could be a play on the appellation of Saint-Amour or a description of the intense Gamay fruits in this rich wine. Either way, it is dense, full of cherry flavors and with a firm structure that will help it age further. Drink from 2019.

title: Ruttenstock 2016 Ried Reipersberg Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: Beautifully pure and aromatic notes of green pear, lemon peel and green spring herbs like tarragon and chervil play on the nose of this wine. The palate shows similar fruity, fresh and lively charm. Very refreshing.

title: Shooting Star 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Very ripe, Port-like flavors and a big but soft presence on the palate give a bold personality to this full-bodied wine. It's deep and concentrated in berry and raisin flavors that are layered and delicious, squeezing dark chocolate and mint between them.

title: Stift Klosterneuburg 2015 Ausstich St. Laurent (Thermenregion)
description: Shy aromas of spice and cherry mark the nose. The palate follows through with abundant, ripe, crunchy and juicy cherry fruit. There is freshness against a slight tannic grip. A wonderfully rustic rendition of St Laurent.
